intro: Matelea magnifolia, commonly known as the showy matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy, funnel-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Matelea magnifolia thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
